required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COVID-19 Vaccination in Patients With Rheumatic Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: NATIONAL VACCINATION REGISTRY FOR SARS-CoV-2 IN PATIENTS WITH RHEUMATIC DISEASES OF THE ARGENTINE SOCIETY OF RHEUMATOLOGY

brief_summary.textblock: The Argentine Society of Rheumatology (SAR) set out to develop a national register of patients with rheumatic diseases who have received a SARS-CoV-2 vaccine in order to assess their efficacy and safety in this population.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is an observational, longitudinal, multicenter study, including patients with rheumatic diseases who have been vaccinated for COVID-19 in Argentine or any country. Patients will be followed for 12 months and two evaluations will be performed, one at baseline and the other after the follow-up time is completed.
The aim of this registry is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the SARS-CoV-2 vaccines in patients with rheumatic diseases.

primary_outcome.description: Number of patients who develop SARS-CoV-2 infection after vaccination
Number of patients who develop adverse events asssociated with vaccination

secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients who develop new immunomediated events asssociated with vaccination. Description of the events.
Number of patients who develop a flare asssociated with vaccination. Description

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the rheumatic disease treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in the rheumatic disease treatment associated with vaccination, and study its influence on the efficacy (number of patients who develop SARS-CoV-2 infection after vaccination) and safety (number of patients who develop adverse events asssociated with vaccination) of the vaccine for SARS-CoV-2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Vaccine efficacy among patients with immune mediated and non-immune mediated rheumatic diseases
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in the efficacy/safety profile of SARS-CoV-2 vaccine among patients with immune mediated and non-immune mediated rheumatic diseases.

intervention.description: Patients with rheumatic diseases who have been vaccinated for COVID-19

study_pop.textblock: Patients with rheumatic diseases who have been vaccinated for COVID-19 in Argentine or any country

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients ≥ 18 years of age.
- Diagnosis of rheumatic disease treated or not with immunosuppressive agents
- Patients who have received at least one dose of a SARS-CoV-2 vaccine
- Signature of informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who express their desire not to participate in the study or who are unable to give their informed consent.

overall_official.affiliation: Unidad de Investigación Sociedad Argentina Reumatología
